meanings.definition: To assign to a new position or role.
meanings.sent1: She was reassigned to a different team.
meanings.sent2: The manager reassigned the project to a more experienced employee.
meanings.sent3: After mixing up the files, the office prankster reassigned everyone's desks as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The teacher reassigned the seating chart, turning the classroom into a new world of friendships and alliances.
meanings.sent5: The detective reassigned the suspect's alibi, revealing a crucial piece of evidence.

meanings.definition: To transfer to a different department or location.
meanings.sent1: The company reassigned him to their overseas branch.
meanings.sent2: She was reassigned to the marketing department.
meanings.sent3: The magician reassigned the disappearing act to a different part of the show, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The wind reassigned the fallen leaves to new spots in the garden, creating a colorful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The captain reassigned the crew to different duties, ensuring the ship ran smoothly.
